授業目的: The objective of this seminar styled class is for the students to enhance their knowledge and critical thinking on auditing research.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of the course you should be able to demonstrate:
(a) a critical appreciation of key issues and research relevant to financial audit;
(b) a critical and theoretical understanding of the role of auditing in corporate accountability;
(c) a critical appreciation of developments and rationales for emerging auditing practices;
授業の概要・背景: The course addresses the theoretical basis of auditing, its role as a risk management function, its practical methodologies and its legal, professional and social environment. Although emphasis of the course will vary depending on the students’ research interest, it will cover, in general financial audit, internal control and risk management, public sector auditing and accounting, and sustainability accounting and auditing.
授業方法:
All lectures are conducted completely face-to-face. 
Each week, students are required to present the assigned study materials. Group discussions will be held to make our understanding comprehensive.

トピック.授業外学習2: This is a quite reading intensive course. Reading materials include text book, academic articles and professional literature related to the research interest of the students. Please find the reading list of each week in the weekly lecture outline section. In addition, in each week students are required to choose an academic article from selected journals and write a review of the paper in 2/3 pages. The review should start with asking the questions like: Why is the article important? What is the research question? and What is the authors’ motivation to write the paper? Subsequently students should also comment on other issues of the paper including research design, theoretical framework, hypothesis development, key findings, and contribution to literature and practice. Recommended academic journals include Accounting, Organizations, and Society; Accounting, Auditing, and Accountability Journal, The Accounting Review; Auditing: A Journal of Practice & Theory; Managerial Auditing Journal, Contemporary Accounting Research; International Journal of Auditing.
